column4: I lost an openoffice file today. Its corrupted, nothing in there. I need to get it back!!
I had a look at ~/.openoffice.org/3/user/backup/ but its empty.
I think I have to grep through my ext4 file system. Is there any chance that I can get my file back?
why you say it is corrupted? Or was that the message at startup?
it was the message at startup
that sounds bad
and you can not find it anywhere?
This file has been created yesterday. 10h of work. No backup, no other copy
I wasnt finished. Wanted to make a backup right now - but the file is corrupted now. F**K!
however annoying it is, (obfuscated) swearing is not allowed here. But at this point, you cannot find the file at all?
I dont have the file at two places. The the file I am working at ~/myfile.odt is corrupted. There is no backupt. The openoffice backup directory is empty. file  ~/myfile.odt : OpenDocument Text.
what you could try is: start oo writer, then Insert > File > myfile.odt
Due to an unexspected error, openoffice.org crahsed ....
now, that's nasty.

any luck yet? Thought of one other possibility, that is opening the corrupted file using an other wordprocessor: "sudo apt-get install abiword" and try opening the document using abiword. Just a tip: while searching for solution, why not make a backupcopy op the (corrupted) doc?
thats a nice try, but abiword only reads "PK????????§D¼<^Æ2" The file size of my broken file is 33K and that should be ok.
getting out of options here :(
you checked your ~/.openoffice/3/user/backup directory, right? Also checked in "temp" instead of backup?
yay!
the stupid thing is that openoffice does not create backups by default.
be sure to enable the backups :)
